media.title: Herbivore functions in the hot-seat: Resilience of Acanthurus triostegus to marine heatwaves
media.description: Herbivorous fishes play a crucial role in the conservation of coral reefs threatened by thermal stress (e.g., marine heatwaves and long-term ocean warming) by helping to maintain reefs in a coral-dominated state via the removal of algae. However, as thermally…

media.title: Pencils with teeth: meet the tiny cookiecutter shark that attacked a catamaran off Cairns
media.description: These parasitic sharks glow in the dark and are known to have a go at anything they come across, despite their small size

media.title: Marine heatwave off north-east Australia sets off alarm over health of Great Barrier Reef
media.description: Experts fear for health of corals and other marine life as about 1m sq km of ocean experience prolonged elevated temperatures

image.alt: Marine heatwave off north-east Australia sets off alarm over health of Great Barrier Reef

media.title: Warm is the new norm for the Great Barrier Reef – and a likely El Niño raises red flags
media.description: The scale of climate threat is beyond the tools we have to manage the Great Barrier Reef. New measures and sustained effort are needed.

image.alt: Warm is the new norm for the Great Barrier Reef – and a likely El Niño raises red flags

media.title: Tiny aquatic athletes: how baby Nemo can ‘just keeping swimming’ from the open ocean to the reef
media.description: New research reveals baby clownfish like Nemo are incredible athletes, able to swim 10-50 body lengths per second. Their athletic traits support their journey from the open ocean back to the reef.

image.alt: Tiny aquatic athletes: how baby Nemo can ‘just keeping swimming’ from the open ocean to the reef

media.title: ‘Extinction crisis’ of sharks and rays to have devastating effect on other species, study finds
media.description: Almost two-thirds of sharks and rays living on world’s coral reefs at risk, with 14 of 134 species reviewed critically endangered

image.alt: ‘Extinction crisis’ of sharks and rays to have devastating effect on other species, study finds

media.title: Annotated solutions for Prize 28,943
media.description: Follow the methodology behind Prize crossword 28,943

media.title: What the next Australian government must do to save the Great Barrier Reef
media.description: Efforts to save the reef aren’t tackling the main cause: climate change. What we need from our next federal government is strong leadership to avert the climate crisis.

image.alt: What the next Australian government must do to save the Great Barrier Reef

media.title: Adapt, move, or die: repeated coral bleaching leaves wildlife on the Great Barrier Reef with few options
media.description: The reef is suffering environmental conditions that are so extreme, scientists are struggling to simulate these scenarios in laboratories.

image.alt: Adapt, move, or die: repeated coral bleaching leaves wildlife on the Great Barrier Reef with few options

media.title: Great Barrier Reef on verge of another mass bleaching after highest temperatures on record
media.description: ‘Shocked and concerned’ US government scientists say heat stress over Australia’s ocean jewel is unprecedented

image.alt: Great Barrier Reef on verge of another mass bleaching after highest temperatures on record

media.title: Ocean scientists call for global tracking of oxygen loss that causes dead zones
media.description: Scientists from six continents say a monitoring system could help protect coral reefs and fisheries around the world

image.alt: Ocean scientists call for global tracking of oxygen loss that causes dead zones

media.title: Marine species increasingly can’t live at equator due to global heating
media.description: Study suggests it is already too warm in tropics for some species to survive

media.title: Will sharks survive? Scientists fear for ocean's apex predators without more protection
media.description: Australia’s spike in shark deaths bears no correlation to how they are doing globally due to overfishing, scientists say

image.alt: Will sharks survive? Scientists fear for ocean's apex predators without more protection

media.title: Le Pacifique : il a beau être le plus grand océan du monde, son écosystème est en péril
media.description: Le Pacifique produit de l’oxygène, aide à réguler le climat, fournit de la nourriture. C’est un lieu de plaisir, de réconfort et de connexion spirituelle. Mais son écologie délicate est menacée.

image.alt: Le Pacifique : il a beau être le plus grand océan du monde, son écosystème est en péril

media.title: Samudra Pasifik: terbesar di dunia namun dalam bahaya
media.description: Samudra Pasifik memproduksi oksigen, membantu pengaturan udara, menyediakan makanan dan mata pencaharian. Ia juga tempat kegembiraan, penghiburan dan spiritualitas. Namun, lautan ini sedang terancam.

image.alt: Samudra Pasifik: terbesar di dunia namun dalam bahaya

media.title: Baby sharks emerge from egg cases earlier and weaker in oceans warmed by climate crisis
media.description: Weaker sharks are less effective hunters, which can upset the balance of the ecosystem, say authors of study into impacts of hotter oceans

image.alt: Baby sharks emerge from egg cases earlier and weaker in oceans warmed by climate crisis

media.title: ¿Qué le ocurre al Pacífico? El océano más grande del mundo está en peligro
media.description: El Océano Pacífico produce oxígeno, ayuda a regular el clima, proporciona alimentos y medios de vida. Es un lugar de diversión, consuelo y conexión espiritual. Pero su delicada ecología está amenazada.

image.alt: ¿Qué le ocurre al Pacífico? El océano más grande del mundo está en peligro

media.title: It might be the world’s biggest ocean, but the mighty Pacific is in peril
media.description: The Pacific Ocean produces oxygen, helps regulates the weather, provides food and livelihoods. It’s a place of fun, solace and spiritual connection. But its delicate ecology is under threat.

image.alt: It might be the world’s biggest ocean, but the mighty Pacific is in peril

media.title: I studied what happens to reef fish after coral bleaching. What I saw still makes me nauseous
media.description: From a scientific perspective, the results are fascinating and world-first. From a personal perspective, what I saw will stay with me for a long time.

image.alt: I studied what happens to reef fish after coral bleaching. What I saw still makes me nauseous
